H0.text: Electromagnet is formed when a solenoid is wrapped around a bar of iron or other ferromagnetic material.

H1.text: Impoundment is what a solenoid wrapped around a bar of iron or other ferromagnetic material forms.

H2.text: A compass is formed by a solenoid wrapped around a bar of iron or other ferromagnetic material.

H3.text: A compress is formed when a solenoid is wrapped around a bar of iron or other ferromagnetic material.

A4.text: When a current passes through the wire wrapped around the core, its magnetic field penetrates the core and turns the domains to align in parallel with the field.

A5.text: The magnetic field of all the turns of wire passes through the center of the coil, creating a strong magnetic field there.
